meta.title: SETjs - A pragmatic frontend framework for the Web
meta.description: The easiest and fastest way to create your new Web project. Implemented in dozens of websites over the last several years, from Fortune 500 companies to blogs about cereal.

meta.title: Introduction to SET - SETjs Documentation
meta.description: First a few words about SetJS. SetJS is not a new experiment. It has been our main recipe for building Single Page Applications [SPAs] and JS heavy web projects. Parts of SetJS have been in production for more than 6 years.

meta.title: Installing SET - SETjs Documentation
meta.description: Here’s a description of the main parts - Detailed release notes for each version are available on GitHub.

meta.title: Getting Started - SETjs Documentation
meta.description: Let's start with some basics using what we already have in the build. A pragmatic frontend framework for the Web

meta.title: Architecture - SETjs Documentation
meta.description: Here’s a description of the main parts. A pragmatic frontend framework for the Web

meta.title: Pages - SETjs Documentation
meta.description: Each page is an object with only one required field comp, which is a function that returns a setjs component created using the getComp function.

meta.title: Templates - SETjs Documentation
meta.description: Templates are pure HTML and allow string interpolation and enhancement via data-* attributes.

meta.title: Sample projects - SETjs Documentation
meta.description: Here's a few projects in the field, using SET v1 and v2.

meta.title: Got some questions? - SETjs Documentation
meta.description: Please get in touch, we love to talk about this, or get in touch with the State Empire crew.
